elements.title: Anders Bure (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Anders Bure created the "first real map" of Sweden (copy pictured)?

elements.title: Brother Jonathan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brother Jonathan by John Neal has been considered the longest work of early American fiction?

elements.title: Mahasweta Chakraborty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 24-year-old Mahasweta Chakraborty of Operation Ganga helped around 800 students return to India during the Russian invasion of Ukraine?

elements.title: Palestine Museum of Natural History (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a "bat ensnared by a plant" was discovered in the garden of the Palestine Museum of Natural History?

elements.title: Ron Monaco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ron Monaco, described as the "longest of long shots", became a starter in the NFL having been just a backup in college?

elements.title: Herky and Timmy's Racing Coaster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Herky and Timmy's Racing Coaster is the first roller coaster in South Korea to go backwards?

elements.title: Julie Cliff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julie Cliff revealed that an outbreak of konzo in Mozambique was caused by cyanide in insufficiently processed cassava?

elements.title: a Florida TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Florida TV station was late to its first broadcast because an engineer overslept?
